dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (Voice Over) Previously on Friends.

events.event_description: JOEY's voice-over introduces the episode with a recap of previous events on Friends.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is eating the picnic as Rachel comes home from work.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I mean, I don’t feel like I even have a girlfriend anymore.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You want me to just quit my job so that you can feel like you’ve got a girlfriend?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Is this about Mark?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (shocked) Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, it’s not, it’s not.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight with you Ross! Look, urrgh, maybe we should take a break.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Fine, you’re right. Let’s ah, let’s take a break, (goes to the door) let’s cool off, okay, let’s get some frozen yoghurt, or something.. (opens the door)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. A break from us.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is eating the picnic as Rachel comes home from work.]

events.event_description: Ross expresses feelings of not having a girlfriend anymore while eating a picnic at Monica and Rachel's apartment.
Rachel arrives home from work and enters the scene.
Ross questions if Rachel's feelings are related to Mark.
Rachel reacts with shock upon hearing Ross's question.
Ross denies that his concern is about Mark.
Rachel exclaims that she cannot continue having the same fight with Ross and suggests taking a break.
Ross agrees with Rachel and suggests they take a break, then moves towards the door to leave.
Rachel firmly states that they should have a break from their relationship.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Mark is there, opening Chinese food boxes.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Then, we had this big, stupid fight, and I said I wanted to take a break, I don’t want to take a break.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on the phone) I’ve been thinking, this is crazy, I mean don’t, don’t you think we can work on this?

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Hey, what do you want to drink?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Who’s that?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Nobody.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Is that Mark?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Umm, honey, look he just came over to....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah! Got it! (slams down the phone)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Mark is there, opening Chinese food boxes.]

events.event_description: Rachel reveals she had a big, stupid fight and said she wanted to take a break, but she clarifies she does not want to take a break.
Ross is on the phone, contemplating and suggesting that they might be able to work on their relationship.
Mark asks Rachel what she wants to drink.
Ross notices that Mark is on the phone and asks Rachel if that is Mark.
Rachel responds to Ross, indicating Mark just came over to the scene.
Ross recognizes that Mark is present and exclaims 'Got it!', then slams down the phone.

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Hey, come dance. What? Are you married? ‘Cause that’s okay.

events.event_description: Chloe invites someone to dance in the scene at The Philly.
Chloe asks the person if they are married, implying concern or curiosity.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is making a fruit drink in the blender, Rachel has
just finished her shower and is coming out of the bathroom.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How’s the big anniversary dinner?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, we never actually got to dinner.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ohhh, nice.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, we kinda broke up instead.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?! (She accidentally starts the blender without the lid on it and fruit flies everywhere.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (looking up at the ceiling) God, Monica it’s on the ceiling.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That’s okay, this is more important than fruit (pause) (angrily) on my ceiling! You broke up?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, but it’s okay, because when Ross left Mark came over.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh no!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rachel, you and Mark?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, no-no, it’s okay, calm down. Mark and I talked, and I realised how much I love your stupid brother, and, yeah, we got our problems, but I really want to make it work.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is making a fruit drink in the blender, Rachel has
just finished her shower and is coming out of the bathroom.]

events.event_description: Monica greets Rachel and inquires about the anniversary dinner.
Rachel reveals she and her partner broke up instead of going to dinner.
Monica accidentally starts the blender without the lid, causing fruit to fly everywhere.
Rachel comments that fruit is on the ceiling.
Monica expresses frustration about the fruit on her ceiling and learns about Rachel's breakup.
Rachel explains that Mark came over after Ross left her, indicating a potential new relationship.
Monica reacts with concern upon hearing about Rachel and Mark.
Rachel clarifies that she and Mark discussed their feelings and decided to try to make their relationship work.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Ross’s Bedroom, Ross is waking up. He straightens himself out on the bed
and puts the covers over his head.]

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: (entering from bathroom) Morning!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Ross’s Bedroom, Ross is waking up. He straightens himself out on the bed
and puts the covers over his head.]

events.event_description: Ross wakes up in his bedroom and straightens himself on the bed.
Ross pulls the covers over his head.
Chloe enters Ross's bedroom from the bathroom.
Chloe greets Ross with 'Morning!'

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Ross’s Kitchen, Ross is taking some aspirin and checking his messages.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on answering machine) Hi, it’s me. I’ve been trying to reach you all night. I feel awful. Please, Ross, you gotta know there is nothing between me and Mark. This whole break-up thing is just stupid.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Eh, I’m just so sorry I put you through it. And, I y'know, I don’t want to get back together over a machine.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Na-huh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So, I love you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I love you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And y'know what, I’m gonna, I’m gonna go to bed now, but ah, on my way to work tomorrow morning, I’m gonna stop by around 8:30.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. (Ross starts frantically looking for a clock.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Bye.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Chloe, Chloe how’s it coming?!!

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: (entering from bedroom) Hey, what kind of puppy do you think I should get?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Umm, oh, hey, I don’t know. How about a big one?

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: But my apartment is so...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well then a small one!! Listen, let’s, we kinda have to get going!

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Wait! Where’s my shoes?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You, you sure you need shoes? (Chloe nods her head) Okay. (reaches down and picks up a shoe)

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Do I know why we’re rushing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, y'know the ah, the girlfriend I told you about last night? (He’s frantically throwing the cushions off of the couch looking for her other shoe) Well it turns out she ah, she wants to get back together with me. Oh, I found it!!

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: That’s so great for you guys!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: You must be so happy!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes I am, one of the many things I’m feeling. Well.... (picks up her coat)

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Good luck, with your girlfriend.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you. (She goes to kiss him, but he holds her coat up between their faces to stop her.) Hey, hey. (opens the door, sees Rachel, and hides Chloe behind the door) Rachel!!!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi. Ohhh, you got my message.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, oh hey, you are right on time.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So what do you say? Can I be your girlfriend again?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, you can, very much.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (seeing the thumbs up) Ahhhh!! (Hugs Rachel tighter.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Ross’s Kitchen, Ross is taking some aspirin and checking his messages.]

events.event_description: Rachel leaves a message on Ross's answering machine expressing her feelings and denying any relationship with Mark.
Ross responds to Rachel's message with an affirmative reply.
Rachel states she loves Ross and plans to visit him around 8:30 the next morning.
Ross frantically searches for a clock to confirm Rachel's visit time.
Chloe enters the scene and asks Ross about what kind of puppy she should get.
Ross suggests Chloe get a small puppy because her apartment is small.
Ross hurriedly prepares to leave, indicating they need to get going.
Ross finds Chloe's shoe after searching frantically on the couch.
Ross informs Chloe that his girlfriend wants to get back together with him.
Ross hides Chloe behind the door upon seeing Rachel and then confirms with Rachel that she is there to see him.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering carry a large box, Monica is mopping
the ceiling.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, why are you mopping your ceiling?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, there’s banana on it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow, I have the spirit of an old Indian women living in mine.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So then you know? (Phoebe nods her head)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: The mailman was downstairs, so I brought up your mail.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, good. Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Now what is Fabutec?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, all right don’t judge me to much. Okay? Um, but I saw this info-mercial, and um, I swear to you I have never-ever bought anything on TV before, except for this mop. But there was this stuff on leg waxing, it just, it looked so amazing....

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Waxine!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes! Have you seen it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it’s incredible! I so want to be a Waxine girl.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: God. Do think it really doesn’t hurt? ‘Cause how can they do that?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hello! Organic substances recently discovered in the depths of the rain forest!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: They have the best stuff in there.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering carry a large box, Monica is mopping
the ceiling.]

events.event_description: Phoebe enters Monica and Rachel's carrying a large box.
Monica is mopping the ceiling.
Phoebe greets Monica with a 'Hey!'.
Phoebe asks Monica why she is mopping the ceiling.
Monica explains she is mopping the ceiling because there is banana on it.
Phoebe comments that she has the spirit of an old Indian woman living in her.
Monica confirms Phoebe knows about her spirit.
Phoebe mentions bringing up Monica's mail from downstairs.
Monica thanks Phoebe for bringing the mail.
Phoebe asks Monica about Fabutec, a product she saw on TV.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross has told Chandler and Joey his terrible act.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh my God! Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. We figured when we couldn’t find you, you’d gone home to make up with Rachel. Which is probably what you shoulda done. Huh?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You think?! God, I, ah, I’m in hell. I mean what, what am I gonna do? Rachel’s all like, ‘I love you and, and let’s work on this.’ And all I can think about is, ‘What is she gonna do? What is she gonna say?’ when I tell her what I did.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, before we answer that, I think we should address the more important question. How dumb are you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?! Look, we’re trying to rebuild a relationship here, right. How am I supposed to do that here, without being totally honest with each other?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, Ross look, I’m on board about this totally honesty thing, I am, just not about stuff that’s gonna get you in trouble.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: He’s right. Nobody’s gonna benefit, and you’re just gonna hurt her.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, and there won’t be a relationship left to rebuild.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, but don’t you think....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right look, if you absolutely have to tell her, at least wait until the timing’s right. And that’s what deathbeds are for.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, okay. (he plops down into one of the leather chairs, with the footrest extended.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, okay, now, we just have to make sure she doesn’t find out some other way. (spins the chair around so that Ross is facing him) Did you think about the trail?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What trail?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (stomps on the footrest which pops Ross up into a sitting position) The trail from the woman you did it with to the woman you hope never finds out who did it! (slapping his hands with each word) You always have to think about the trail!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I-I don’t think there’s any trail.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, okay-okay, ah, Chloe works with that guy Issac. Issac’s sister is Jasmine. And Jasmine works at that message place with Phoebe. And Phoebe’s friends with Rachel. And that’s the trail, I did it!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross has told Chandler and Joey his terrible act.]

events.event_description: Ross confesses to Chandler and Joey that he has committed a terrible act.
Chandler reacts with shock and exclaims, 'Oh my God!'
Joey suggests that Ross should have made up with Rachel instead of hiding the truth.
Ross expresses his anxiety about telling Rachel the truth, fearing her reaction.
Chandler questions Ross about his level of stupidity regarding the situation.
Joey advocates for honesty but warns against revealing information that could cause trouble.
Chandler advises Ross to wait for the right moment to tell Rachel, comparing it to deathbeds.
Ross sits down in a leather chair with the footrest extended, indicating a moment of contemplation.
Joey emphasizes the importance of covering the trail to prevent Rachel from discovering the truth.
Joey explains the concept of the 'trail' from the woman Ross cheated with to Rachel, listing connections between characters.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica's Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are waxing their legs.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (reading from the instructions) After applying the Waxine and linen strips to leg number one,

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did that!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Grasp one of the linen strips by its ‘easy grab tab’ and pull it off in one quick pain free motion.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. (Does so.) Ow!!!!! Ow-oh-oh!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Was it not pain-free?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No. It was painful. Oh my God , they should call it Pain-zine, now with a little wax.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Huh, well, the girls in the satin nighties on the commercial don’t seem to think it’s that bad.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That’s because their nerves are probably deadened from being so stupid. But hey, y'know if you don’t believe me, please, by my guest.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Removing one of the strips) Ow-ow-ow-ow! Oh my God!!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Now, are you glad we didn’t start with the bikini strips?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica's Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are waxing their legs.]

events.event_description: Phoebe reads the instructions aloud for waxing procedure, mentioning applying Waxine and linen strips to leg number one.
Monica confirms she has already applied the wax and linen strips to her leg.
Phoebe instructs Monica to grasp a linen strip by its 'easy grab tab' and pull it off quickly.
Monica pulls the linen strip off her leg and reacts with pain, exclaiming 'Ow!!!!! Ow-oh-oh!'.
Phoebe asks Monica if it was pain-free, implying she is experiencing the waxing process.
Monica admits the waxing was painful and comments on the commercial's portrayal of waxing as painless.
Phoebe removes another linen strip and reacts with pain, exclaiming 'Ow-ow-ow-ow! Oh my God!!!'.
Monica comments on not starting with bikini strips to avoid more pain.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Xerox Place, Ross is trying to break the trail.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Chloe? Hi..

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Is this about me taking your watch?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You took my watch?

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, I do that.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Just you keep it, listen did you, did you tell anyone about us?

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Oh no. I feel it isn’t really anybody’s business, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Exactly. So you didn’t, didn’t mention anything to Issac right?

dialogue.speaker: CHLOE
dialogue.text: Oh, well I tell Issac everything.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You tell, of course you do. Issac. Issac. Hey, Issac. Issac, hi! Y'know we haven’t actually met...

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: You dog!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, I suppose I am a dog. But Issac, see I-I happen to have a girlfriend.

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: Oh right, that Rachel chick from the coffee place.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, that’s the one. Listen, I don’t want to hurt her.

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: Oh, hey, man I know, doesn’t matter how much we love ‘em, monogamy is too cruel a rule.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. Listen, can you keep this information to yourself?

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: Aw, no problem dude. Y'know we got to look out for each other. We’re the same, you and me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Actually, no, we’re not.

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: Yeah, we are.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, we’re not.

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: Yeah, we are.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, we’re not!!

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: Okay, we’re not.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: But, we are.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Fine. I just need to know that you’re not gonna tell your sister.

dialogue.speaker: ISSAC
dialogue.text: I can promise not to tell her again.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Xerox Place, Ross is trying to break the trail.]

events.event_description: Ross enters the scene and greets Chloe.
Chloe asks Ross if the scene is about her taking his watch.
Chloe admits to taking Ross's watch and apologizes.
Ross asks Chloe if she told anyone about their relationship.
Chloe responds that she tells Issac everything.
Ross calls out to Issac and introduces himself.
Issac insults Ross by calling him a dog.
Ross admits to being a dog and states he has a girlfriend.
Issac mentions Rachel from the coffee place, implying knowledge of Ross's relationship.
Ross asks Issac to keep their conversation secret.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s Work, Ross is now trying to stop Jasmine from telling Phoebe.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering out of breath) Jasmine?

dialogue.speaker: JASMINE
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We met at Phoebe’s birthday party, I’m, I’m Ross Geller.

dialogue.speaker: JASMINE
dialogue.text: You did a bad thing!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, I did.

dialogue.speaker: JASMINE
dialogue.text: Very bad!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Very bad.

dialogue.speaker: JASMINE
dialogue.text: Very, very bad.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I’m agreeing with you. Did you, listen, did you happen to tell Phoebe yet?

dialogue.speaker: JASMINE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, Jasmine, please, please don’t. I love my girlfriend very much, and I want more than anything to just work it out with her. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: JASMINE
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you, thank you.

dialogue.speaker: JASMINE
dialogue.text: But you should probably talk to my roommate, because I told him and he knows Phoebe too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (angrily) Who’s your roommate?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s Work, Ross is now trying to stop Jasmine from telling Phoebe.]

events.event_description: Ross enters Phoebe's work area, catching Jasmine's attention.
Jasmine confirms her identity to Ross by saying 'Uh-huh'.
Ross introduces himself to Jasmine, stating he met her at Phoebe's birthday party.
Jasmine accuses Ross of having done a bad thing.
Ross admits to having done a bad thing.
Jasmine emphasizes that Ross's action was very bad.
Ross agrees with Jasmine that his action was very bad.
Ross asks Jasmine if she has told Phoebe about his bad action.
Jasmine responds that she has not told Phoebe yet.
Ross pleads with Jasmine not to tell Phoebe, expressing his love for Phoebe and desire to work things out.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Gunther is wiping down the counter as Ross rushes in.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Gunther! Gunther. Gunther, please tell me you didn’t say anything to Rachel about me and the girl from the Xerox place.

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: I’m sorry. Was I not supposed to?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Gunther is wiping down the counter as Ross rushes in.]

events.event_description: Ross rushes into Central Perk and calls out to Gunther.
Ross asks Gunther if he told Rachel about his interaction with the girl from the Xerox place.
Gunther responds apologetically, indicating he did tell Rachel.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica’s Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are removing the rest of their wax
strips.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ow!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ow!! Ow!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ow!!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ow!!!!!!! Ow-ow-ow-ow!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: We’re all right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s okay, it’s okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: We’re all right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We were just waxing our legs.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Off?!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: For your information, this happens to be a pain like no man will ever experience.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, well I don’t think you can make that statement, unless you’ve been kicked in an area that God only meant to be treated nicely.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, I-I think that women just have a lower threshold of pain than men, that’s all. I mean, come on, it’s just a little wax.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, come here. (Puts a little wax on Joey’s arm and puts a strip on it.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s mature.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, fine, so now what, I just pull it off?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That’s right.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (forcing the door open) Come on, Rachel, come on! Talk to me! Please!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I can’t talk to you. I can’t even look at you right now!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nothing, nothing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (going over to listen at the door) Rachel said everything was okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Joey) What, what are they talking about?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rachel?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Just get away from me!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, it was a mistake! I made a mistake! Okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: A mistake?! What were you trying to put it in? Her purse?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Whe-where did he put it?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, you had sex with another woman!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I knew something had to be wrong, because my fingernails did not grow at all yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, I guess they had a fight, and he got drunk....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh!! (hits Chandler and Joey in the head) You guys knew about this and you didn’t tell us?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) He has sex, and we get hit in our heads.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (opening the door) Y'know what, I want you to leave! Get outta here!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Just get out! Now!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No!! No!! I wanna stay. I wanna talk about this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay! All right! How was she?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Uh-oh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Was she good?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Don’t answer that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on Ross! You said you wanted to talk about it, let’s talk about it!! How was she?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She was...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Awful! Horrible!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She was not good. Not good.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: She was nothing compared to you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She, she was different.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ewwwww!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Uh-oh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Good different?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nobody likes change.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? Okay, okay, okay, okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Should we do something?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, never cheat on Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, okay, I’m sorry. I wa-I was disgusted with myself, and this morning I was so, I was so upset and then I got your message and I was so happy, and all I wanted was to get her out of my apartment as fast as possible.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Whoa!! Whoa, whoa, wait a minute. What time did your little friend leave? (Ross can’t answer that) Oh my God. She was there? She was still there? She was in there, when I was in there?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Listen. Oh hey, hey, the important thing was that she meant, she meant nothing to me!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And yet she was worth jeopardising our relationship!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, I didn’t think there was a relationship to jeopardise. I thought we were broken up.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We were on a break!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That, for all I knew would, could last forever. That to me is a break-up.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You think you’re gonna get out of this on a technicality?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, I’m not trying to get out of anything, okay. I thought our relationship was dead!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, you sure had a hell of a time at the wake!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Y'know what, I don’t think we should listen to this anymore. (Goes to open the door)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (stopping him) What, what are you doing? You can’t go out there.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Why not?! (to Chandler) I’m hungry.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Because they’ll know we’ve been listening.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: God! And to have to hear about it from Gunther!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on! Like I wanted him to tell you, I ran all over the place trying to make sure that didn’t happen!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, that is so sweet. I think I’m falling in love with you all over again.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know what, I think we can go out there. I mean they have more important things to worry about.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, we’ll be fine.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look Rachel, I wanted to tell you, I thought I should, I-I did, and then Chandler and Joey convinced me not to.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (handing Monica the wax) Wax the door shut, we’re never leaving, ever.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi, it’s Phoebe. Listen someone’s gonna have to take my 9:00 with Mr. Rehack, ‘cause it’s like 9:15 now, and I’m not there.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Don’t you realise none of this would’ve ever happened if I didn’t think at that same moment you weren’t having sex with Mark?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right. Let’s say I had slept with Mark. Would you have been able to forgive me?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (pause) Yes I would.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You’d be okay if you knew that Mark had kissed me, and been naked with me, and made love to me?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (less sure) Yes.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You knew that our hot, sweaty, writhing bodies were....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (covering his ears and screaming) La-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la! Okay, okay, yeah, I would have been devastated but, I would still want to be with you. Because it’s, I mean it’s you.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Ohhhhh!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? Come on Rach, tell me what you’re thinking?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m thinking, I’m gonna order a pizza.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Order a pizza like, ‘I forgive you?’

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh man, pizza? I like pizza. (makes like he is trying to send a telepathic message to Rachel) Put olives on the pizza.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: We could eat the wax! It’s organic.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh great, food with hair on it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, not the used wax.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Because that would be crazy?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, can I, can I get in on that? Because I’m kinda hungry myself.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Fine. (on phone) Hi! Yes, I’d like to order a large pizza.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No anchovies.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: With ah, extra anchovies.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That’s okay, I’ll just pick ‘em off.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, and could you please chop some up and just put it right there in the sauce?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You can have the last piece, if you want.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I should think so. You slept with someone.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: They’re gonna get through this, aren’t they?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, come on, it’s Ross and Rachel, they’ve got too.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What if they don’t?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You think I need a new walk?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well y'know, I’ve been walking the same way since high school. Y'know, y'know how some guys they walk into a room and everybody takes notice. I think I need a ‘take notice’ walk.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Are you actually saying these words?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, now you’re not even taking to me? (moves over to the coffee table) Look Rachel, I-I’m sorry, okay, I’m sorry, I was out of my mind. I thought I’d lost you, I didn’t know what to do. Come on! Come on, how insane must I have been to do something like this? Huh? I-I don’t cheat right, I, that’s not me, I’m not Joey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa-ho-ho! (He looks at Chandler, who gives him a ‘come on’ look.) Yeah, okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey. It’s three in the morning. They don’t know that I’ve come home yet. You notice how neither one of them are wondering where I am.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, y'know, people can be so self-involved.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Y'know what, y'know what, I’m-I’m not the one that wanted that, that break, okay. You’re the one that bailed on us. You’re the one that, that ran when things got just a little rough!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That’s....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That’s what?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That is neither here nor there.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, well here we are. Now we’re in a tough spot again, Rach. What do you want to do? How do you want to handle it? Huh? Do you wanna fight for us? Or, do you wanna bail? (sits down next to her) Look, I, (on the verge of tears) I did a terrible, stupid, stupid thing. Okay? And I’m sorry, I wish I could take it back, but I can’t. (We see Monica and Phoebe are almost in tears.) I just can’t see us throwing away something we know is so damn good. Rachel, I love you so much.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No Ross!! (stands up and moves away from him) Don’t! You can’t just kiss me and think you’re gonna make it all go away, okay? It doesn’t work that way. It doesn’t just make it better. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (softly) I think you should go.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (softly) I really think you need to go now.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (moving over to stand in front of her) Okay, okay. This morning you said there was nothing so big that we couldn’t work past it together...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, what the hell did I know!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, look, there’s got to be a way we can work past this. Okay, (takes a hold of one of her arms.) I can’t imagine, I can’t imagine my life without you. (Both of them are starting to cry.) Without, without these arms, and your face, and this heart. Your good heart Rach, (drops to his knees and hugs her around her waist) and, and....

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (crying) No. I can’t, you’re a totally different person to me now. I used to think of you as somebody that would never, ever hurt me, ever. God, and now I just can’t stop picturing with her, I can’t, (Ross stands up and backs away) it doesn’t matter what you say, or what you do, Ross. It’s just changed, everything. Forever.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (crying) Yeah, but this can’t be it, I mean.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Then how come it is?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica’s Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are removing the rest of their wax
strips.]

events.event_description: Monica and Phoebe remove their wax strips from their legs.
Monica and Phoebe react to the pain of waxing, expressing their discomfort.
Phoebe reassures Monica that they are all right after waxing.
Chandler comments on Phoebe's statement about pain, implying it is exaggerated.
Joey volunteers to try waxing on his arm, with Phoebe applying wax and a strip.
Ross forces open the door, pleading with Rachel to talk to him.
Rachel refuses to look at Ross and tells him to leave.
Rachel accuses Ross of having sex with another woman, causing Monica and Phoebe to react with shock.
Rachel confronts Ross about his infidelity, leading to a heated argument about their relationship status.
Rachel decides to end the relationship, telling Ross to leave her apartment.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: They’ve been quiet for a long time.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Maybe she killed him?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Let’s go.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Is that your new walk?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (whispering) No, I really have to pee.

events.event_description: PHOEBE comments that the characters have been quiet for a long time.
JOEY suggests that someone might have been killed.
CHANDLER decides to leave the scene.
CHANDLER asks Joey if that is his new walk.
JOEY whispers that he needs to pee, indicating a desire to leave or pause the conversation.
